revised_title: The Complex Structure and Composition of the Brachiopod Discina Shell
tldr: The study examines the intricate structure and composition of the organophosphatic shell of the brachiopod Discina. The shell is made up of thin, impersistent layers with a vertical canal system and organic strands. The basic unit of the shell is an apatitic granule with a chitino-proteinaceous coat, which is assembled and aggregated into spherules within the outer epithelium of the mantle. The shell's distinctiveness depends on the proportions of its organic and biomineral components and the aggregation of its apatitic mosaics.
